results.title: Science for the tropics
results.creator_credit: Tony Baker, Richard Tamblind and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: A look at the work of the Tropical Products Institute in London, an organisation which assists third world countries to exploit their natural resources commercially. The Institute also does much laboratory work relating to agricultural issues. The film contains quite technical examinations of several projects the Institute has been involved in.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Baker, Richard Tamblind and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: Science for the space age: waves and energy
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains that there are many kinds of waves, including water, sound, light and radio waves. Uses illustrations and experiments to show how waves carry energy from one place to another. Describes the relationship between frequency and wave length; and explains how radio waves carry information.

results.title: Science and technology in Japan
results.creator_credit: Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Toei
results.brief_description: A popular study of recent developments in science and technology in Japan showing new methods being used in the fields of electronics, shipbuilding and the petroleum industry.

results.title: Schubert and his music
results.brief_description: Depicts life in the early 19th century and the people and places of Vienna which have had an important influence on the music of Franz Schubert. Shows Schubert’s birth place, the church where he sang as a boy and where, later, his music was performed, life in Vienna and the group of singers, painters, poets and actors who were part of the romantic movement of this period. Excerpts from the following are included in the film: Valses Nobles, Opus 77; Moment Musicaux, Opus 94; the First and Second Movements of the Symphony No. 8 “Unfinished”; “Der Lindenbaum”; the First Movement of the Quintet in A Major, Opus 114 “The Trout”; and “Serenade”.

results.title: Schools out
results.creator_credit: Alex Rappel, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Examines three innovative schools - Brinsley Road an annexe to Camberwell High school, Collingwood Community school, and Swinburne Community school. Students and teachers comment on the differences between these and traditional schools, and the relationships between pupils, teachers, and the community.

results.title: Schools and school discipline. Tape 2.= Communication and motivation.
results.brief_description: Dr. William Glasser, founder of the Institute of Reality Therapy, discusses motivation in schools. Besides making sure that every student believes he or she has a chance in school, Dr. Glasser also stresses, through related examples, the inherent motivational qualities of courtesy and laughter, and the importance of communication with students through his use of classroom meetings.

results.title: School day in Japan
results.brief_description: Illustrates a typical school day in the life of a young Japanese boy and his sister. Shows the way in which education in Japan has been influenced by the West whilst retaining many old traditions.

results.title: School as a resource unit (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: A case study of a resource-centred junior school. Children and staff of a British school are seen in normal school activities, many of which involve the use of multi-media material from the school resource centre.

results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk
results.brief_description: Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk is a 1942 short propaganda film by Charles A. Ridley of the UK Ministry of Information. It consists of edited existing footage taken from Leni Riefenstahl’s Triumph of the Will.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

results.description:
Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk is a 1942 short propaganda film by Charles A. Ridley of the UK Ministry of Information. It consists of edited existing footage taken from Leni Riefenstahl’s Triumph of the Will to make it appear as if they were dancing to the dance style The Lambeth Walk.

The film was distributed uncredited to newsreel companies.

  • Wikipedia
description_for_label:
Schichlegruber - Doing the Lambeth Walk is a 1942 short propaganda film by Charles A. Ridley of the UK Ministry of Information. It consists of edited existing footage taken from Leni Riefenstahl’s Triumph of the Will to make it appear as if they were dancing to the dance style The Lambeth Walk.

The film was distributed uncredited to newsreel companies.

  • Wikipedia
